intro: Antidesma aruanum, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries, which are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
